CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 24, 1945, pg. 13 reads: "'I Pronounce You' - Miss Estella Hord and Sgt. Lorenzo Hill were joined in holy matrimony at Holy Cross Church in a nuptial mass service performed by Father Charles Levy. Sergeant Hill recently returned from service in European theatre, and is stationed in Chicago.  The charming bride is the daughter of the Earl V. Hords (Courier business manager). - Courier Photo by Harris." Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper February 24, 1945, reads: "Delightful Wedding Celebration - Of interest to their many friends throughout the country was the wedding of Miss Estella Hord, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Earl V. Hord on Bryn Mawr Road, and Sgt. Lorenzo Hill, son of the William E. Hills of Elmore Square. The double-ring ceremony was performed last Thursday evening at Holy Cross Church, with Father Charles Levy officiating. A reception of charming appointments followed the wedding, at the home of the bride's parents. in the photo are (foreground) left to right: The groom's parents, the bridal pair cutting the cake, and the bride's parents. - Courier Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Bride Estella Hord Hill and groom Lorenzo Hill wearing military uniform, standing before Father Charles Levy in Holy Cross Church on their wedding day
